security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate ArcBlock blocklet converter skill that converts static web and Next.js projects into deployable blocklet packages. The skill runs standard build commands and generates configuration files using the official blocklet CLI. All capabilities are appropriate for the stated development tooling purpose.

content.user_title: Convert web projects to ArcBlock blocklets
content.value_statement: Deploying web projects to ArcBlock requires specific configuration and setup. This skill automates the conversion of static websites and Next.js applications into deployable blocklet packages with proper DID integration.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes project structure to detect web applications
Identifies Next.js and static webapp project types
Extracts metadata from package.json for blocklet configuration
Runs build commands with bun or pnpm package managers
Validates blocklet setup using blocklet CLI commands
limitations: Requires a pre-generated blocklet DID parameter
Does not support backend frameworks like Express, Koa, or NestJS
Requires blocklet CLI to be installed globally
Only converts projects with web dependencies or index.html

best_practices: Generate a valid blocklet DID before conversion using blocklet create --did-only --random
Ensure the project has a working build script in package.json
Install the blocklet CLI globally with npm install -g @blocklet/cli before conversion
anti_patterns: Attempting to convert backend-only projects without web frontends
Using an invalid or malformed DID format
Running conversion without first ensuring the build process works locally

faq.question: What project types are supported?
faq.answer: Static webapps with index.html and Next.js projects. Backend frameworks like Express, Koa, and NestJS are not supported.

faq.question: Where do I get a blocklet DID?
faq.answer: Generate one using the blocklet CLI: blocklet create --did-only --random

faq.question: Does this skill install dependencies?
faq.answer: Yes, it runs bun install or pnpm install if a build script is detected in package.json.

faq.question: Is my project data safe?
faq.answer: The skill only accesses files within your project directory for conversion purposes.

faq.question: What if the build fails?
faq.answer: The skill reports build errors and exits immediately. Fix local build issues before retrying.

faq.question: How is this different from manual blocklet creation?
faq.answer: Automates project detection, metadata extraction, template population, and CLI validation steps.
